intro: Luthera virginica, commonly known as the Virginia larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy and sometimes toxic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces tall spikes of blue to purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance that helps in identification.
